creator: froder@trustix.com
text:
Using the RemoveType directive in a VirtualHost directive works for me.
The documentation however, specifies that it shouldn't.

Example:

  AddType application/application/x-httpd-php .php
  <VirtualHost A>
  RemoveType .php
  ..
  </VirtualHost>
  <VirtualHost B>
  ..
  </VirtualHost>

Here PHP is enabled for the default server and virtual host B, but not for 
virtual host A. 

I noticed that the Apache 2.0 documentation for the RemoveType directive 
includes virtual host in the context specification.
http://httpd.apache.org/docs-2.0/mod/mod_mime.html#removetype
